text:
In the unit, we are using factors and multiples to explore and represent some properties of the multiplicative structure of numbers and to solve problems. At the end of this investigation, ask yourself:

How can you express the multiplicative patterns and relationships of whole numbers with words, numeric expressions, and algebraic expressions.

Student answers might include discussions such as the following:

  • Things that cycle or repeat together lead to looking at least common multiples.
  • Things where you are looking at breaking two numbers into common groupings of things lead to common factors and greatest common factor.
